## problem-matcher package

Parse VS Code style problem matcher definitions and use them to extract structured problem reports from strings.

## Functions

<table><thead><tr><th>

Function


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

[parseProblemMatchersJson(problemMatchers)](./problem-matcher.parseproblemmatchersjson.md)


</td><td>

Parse VS Code problem matcher JSON definitions into [IProblemMatcher](./problem-matcher.iproblemmatcher.md) objects.


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

## Interfaces

<table><thead><tr><th>

Interface


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

[IProblem](./problem-matcher.iproblem.md)


</td><td>

Represents a problem (generally an error or warning) detected in the console output.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[IProblemMatcher](./problem-matcher.iproblemmatcher.md)


</td><td>

A problem matcher processes one line at a time and returns an [IProblem](./problem-matcher.iproblem.md) if a match occurs.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[IProblemMatcherJson](./problem-matcher.iproblemmatcherjson.md)


</td><td>

Minimal VS Code problem matcher definition.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[IProblemPattern](./problem-matcher.iproblempattern.md)


</td><td>

VS Code style problem matcher pattern definition.


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>
